intro: Cyanea palakea, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows along coastal areas and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyanea palakea plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
